arduino

Class NetworkRobotCom

  • java.lang.Object
    • arduino.RobotCom<java.nio.channels.SocketChannel>
      • arduino.NetworkRobotCom

  • public class NetworkRobotCom
extends RobotCom<java.nio.channels.SocketChannel>
    This class represents a connection to an Arduino over Ethernet.
    Author:
    Jacob Glueck

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int PORT
      The port on which all communications are done.

        public static final int PORT

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetworkRobotCom

        public NetworkRobotCom(RobotInfo ri)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Makes a new NetworkArduinoCom at the specified IP. This puts the socket into non-blocking and calls connect. Thus, SocketChannel.finishConnect() should be called before attempting to read.
        Parameters:
        ri - the info of the robot to connect to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem.

      • getLocationString

        public java.lang.String getLocationString()
        Description copied from class: RobotCom
        Returns the location to which the ArduinoCom is connected. For example, if it is connected through a serial port, this method might return "COM3" or if it is connected through a network, the IP address.
        Specified by:
        getLocationString in class RobotCom<java.nio.channels.SocketChannel>
        Returns:
        A string describing what the ArduinoCom is connected to.

                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: RobotCom
        Waits for the initialization process to end.
        Specified by:
        waitForInitialization in class RobotCom<java.nio.channels.SocketChannel>
        Returns:
        true if the robot was initialized successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the initialization process was interrupted.
